Title.evidence: Pleural spread or recurrence of thymic epithelial tumors (TETs) is a tricky puzzle in the clinic and there is currently no recognized effective treatment.

Intervention.evidence: receiving S-HITOC with 25 mg/m 2 doxorubicin and 50 mg/m 2 cisplatin

Objective.evidence: This trial evaluated the safety and efficacy of cytoreductive surgery and hyperthermic intrathoracic chemotherapy (S-HITOC) for TETs with pleural spread or recurrence.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The estimated 2-year PFS and OS rates were 82.8% and 100.0%, respectively.

Harms.evidence: Treatment-related adverse events of grade ≥3 occurred in eight (17.8%) patients.
